verses.verse: Don't<WH1984> boast about tomorrow;<WH4279> for you don't<WH3045> know what a day<WH4279> may bring forth.<WH3205>
Let another man<WH2114> praise<WH1984> you,<WH6310> and not your own mouth; a stranger,<WH5237> and not your own lips.<WH8193>
A stone<WH68> is heavy,<WH3514> and sand<WH2344> is a burden;<WH5192> but a fool<WH191>'s provocation<WH3708> is heavier<WH3515> than both.<WH8147>
Wrath<WH2534> is cruel,<WH395> and anger<WH639> is overwhelming;<WH7858> but who is able to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> jealousy?<WH7068>
Better<WH2896> is open<WH1540> rebuke<WH8433> than hidden<WH5641> love.<WH160>
Faithful<WH539> are the wounds<WH6482> of a friend;<WH157> although the kisses<WH5390> of an enemy<WH8130> are profuse.<WH6280>
A full<WH7649> soul<WH5315> loathes<WH947> a honeycomb;<WH5317> but to a hungry<WH7457> soul,<WH5315> every bitter thing<WH4751> is sweet.<WH4966>
As a bird<WH6833> that wanders<WH5074> from her nest,<WH7064> so is a man<WH376> who wanders<WH5074> from his home.<WH4725>
Perfume<WH7004> and incense<WH8081> bring joy<WH8055> to the heart;<WH3820> so<WH4986> does earnest<WH5315> counsel<WH6098> from a man<WH7453>'s friend.

Don't<WH5800> forsake your friend<WH7453> and your father<WH1>'s friend.<WH7453> Don't<WH935> go to your brother<WH251>'s house<WH1004> in the day<WH3117> of your disaster:<WH343> better<WH2896> is a neighbor<WH7934> who is near<WH7138> than a distant<WH7350> brother.<WH251>
Be wise,<WH2449> my son,<WH1121> and bring joy<WH8055> to my heart,<WH3820> then I can answer<WH7725> my tormentor.<WH2778>
A prudent<WH6175> man sees<WH7200> danger<WH7451> and takes refuge;<WH5641> but the simple<WH6612> pass on,<WH5674> and suffer for it.<WH6064>
Take<WH3947> his garment<WH899> when he puts up collateral<WH6148> for a stranger.<WH2114> Hold<WH2254> it for a wayward woman!<WH5237>
He who blesses<WH1288> his neighbor<WH7453> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH7925> it will be taken<WH2803> as a curse by him.<WH7045>
A continual<WH2956> dropping<WH1812> on a rainy<WH5464> day<WH3117> and a contentious<WH4079> wife<WH802> are alike:<WH7737>
restraining<WH6845> her is like restraining<WH6845> the wind,<WH7307> or like grasping<WH7121> oil<WH8081> in his right hand.<WH3225>
Iron<WH1270> sharpens<WH2300> iron;<WH1270> so a man<WH376> sharpens<WH2300> his friend<WH7453>'s countenance.<WH6440>
Whoever tends<WH5341> the fig tree<WH8384> shall eat<WH398> its fruit.<WH6529> He who looks<WH8104> after his master<WH113> shall be honored.<WH3513>
As water<WH4325> reflects a face,<WH6440> so a man<WH120>'s heart<WH3820> reflects<WH120> the man.<WH120>
Sheol<WH7585> and Abaddon<WH11> are never<WH3808> satisfied;<WH7646> and a man<WH120>'s eyes<WH5869> are never satisfied.<WH7646>
The crucible<WH4715> is for silver,<WH3701> and the furnace<WH3564> for gold;<WH2091> but man<WH376> is refined<WH6310> by his praise.<WH4110>
Though you grind<WH3806> a fool<WH191> in a mortar<WH4388> with<WH8432> a pestle<WH5940> along with grain,<WH7383> yet his foolishness<WH200> will not be removed from him.<WH5493>
Know<WH3045> well<WH3045> the state<WH6440> of your flocks,<WH6629> and pay<WH3820> attention<WH7896> to your herds:<WH5739>
for riches<WH2633> are not forever,<WH5769> nor does even the crown<WH5145> endure to all<WH1755> generations.<WH1755>
The hay<WH2682> is removed,<WH2682> and the new growth<WH1877> appears,<WH7200> the grasses<WH6212> of the hills<WH2022> are gathered in.<WH622>
The lambs<WH3532> are for your clothing,<WH3830> and the goats<WH6260> are the price<WH4242> of a field.<WH7704>
There will be plenty<WH1767> of goats<WH5795>' milk<WH2461> for your food,<WH3899> for your family<WH1004>'s food,<WH3899> and for the nourishment<WH2416> of your servant girls.<WH5291>
